DOC.detailed_description: The objective study : 1 ) examine impact exercise sympathetic vascular function pregnancy ; 2 ) examine role endothelial function vascular effect exercise pregnancy . Study design : 100 woman ( > 18yrs ) recruit first second trimester ( < 20 wks ) . Women multiple pregnancy exclude . Eligible woman randomize aerobic exercise intervention ( EXER ) intervention ( CTRL ) . Initial test take place 16-20 week pregnancy . Following initial baseline testing , woman randomly assign exercise intervention intervention . Women receive opaque sequentially number envelop allocation . Allocation determine use randomly generate allocation sequence individual associate research study . The intervention consist aerobic exercise equivalent 50-70 % heart rate reserve , 3-4 time per week end study ( 34-36 week ) . For initial baseline testing ( 16-20 week ) end intervention ( 34-36 week ) , participant visit laboratory twice On Day 1 , participant complete peak exercise test treadmill bike volitional fatigue measure fitness cardiovascular/cerebrovascular response exercise . On Day 2 Participants arrive fast ( 12 hr ) blood sample collect . Anthropometrics , personal/familial history hypertension pregnancy complication record . Following standardized breakfast , participant undergo assessment reflex neurovascular control include cold pressor test , flow mediate dilation end expiratory voluntary breath hold . Muscle sympathetic nerve activity , ultrasound ( blood flow diameter brachial , femoral carotid artery ) , blood pressure , heart rate respiratory variable measure . OUTCOME/IMPACT Pregnancy stress-test life ; woman develop complication pregnancy high risk cardiovascular disease later life . Exercise well know prevent cardiovascular disease improvement endothelial function sympathetic nervous system . Whether improvement also see pregnancy remain see .
